content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you can implement this in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks using regex
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, 1))

    # If there are no matches, return an empty string
    if isempty(matches)
        return ""
    end

    # Join the code blocks together with a newline and remove code fences
    code = join([match[1] for match in matches]; "\n")
    code = replace(code, "`" => "")

    return code
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of Julia code blocks in the markdown document. It then joins these blocks together with a newline character and removes any remaining backticks (code fences). If there are no matches, it returns an empty string.
